components.content: Alternative proposals are worth 3% of your total score.

components.name: ODXhvT

pages.title: How will accommodation be sourced and what steps will be taken to ensure that the properties secured and the tenancies provided are in alignment with housing legislation?

components.title: How will accommodation be sourced and what steps will be taken to ensure that the properties secured and the tenancies provided are in alignment with housing legislation?
components.name: TXFOoA

components.content:
Your delivery plan should include a fully detailed breakdown of your provision offer.

You should highlight any activities you propose to carry out across the entire project (not just for the households in your bid) and associated costs outside of core costs. For example, matching across the scheme.

Your delivery plan will be assessed if you score over 50% across all of the word-limited answers. The maximum weighting will be 15% for the full submitted delivery plan when this is assessed.
components.name: XHZgie

pages.title: What are the intended geographical areas for supporting and accommodating households?

components.title: What are the intended geographical areas for supporting and accommodating households?
components.name: wGBlPx

components.content:
In this section, we'll ask about:

  • how you will work with and build relationships with devolved administrations, local authorities and Strategic Migration Partners
  • how you will recruit and train Sponsor Groups
  • how accommodation will be sourced and what steps will be taken to ensure that the properties secured and the tenancies provided are in alignment with housing legislation
  • what the intended geographical areas are for supporting and accommodating households
  • the proposed delivery model
  • whether you have alternative proposals for matching households to Sponsor Groups
  • your alternative proposals for matching households to Sponsor Groups (if applicable)
  • how awarded funding, budgets and costs will be monitored against delivery of the programme
  • how you will deal with over or underperformance against your delivery plan
  • what the contingency measures and escalation routes are to address issues in delivery in contrast to overall funding/project risk management
  • how you will ensure the households are successfully integrated into the local community
  • your delivery plan, including a fully detailed breakdown of your provision offer and activities you propose to carry out across the entire project
components.name: zdbxTq

pages.title: What is the proposed delivery model?

components.title: What is the proposed delivery model?
components.hint:
This should include:

  • your organisation/consortium structure
  • staffing within your organisation or consortium including staff and volunteers, and the number of households and sponsor groups supported by staff and volunteers
  • the geographical spread of your staff and volunteers
